    style={{
      display: "inline-block",
      width: "36px",
      height: "36px",
      position: "relative",
      top: "10px",
    }}
  />
);

# Layout Components

### A whole new world :sparkles:

---

#### Global search for:

```
display: flex;

// or

display: grid;
```

---

## Layout Components

1. What is Layout?
2. What are the problems?
3. What are these components?
4. Benefits
5. Where to look for inspiration
6. QA

<Split style={{ textAlign: 'left', width: '90%' }}>

<Img
  src="https://penguin-talk-images.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/layout-components/buttons_mock_close.svg"
  alt="twitter mock"
  width="400px"
/>

```html
<div class="button-list">
  <button>Cancel</button>
  <button>Done</button>
</div>
```

</Split>

---

<Split style={{ textAlign: 'left', width: '90%' }}>

<Img
  src="https://penguin-talk-images.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/layout-components/buttons_mock_space.svg"
  alt="twitter mock"
  width="400px"
/>

```html
<div class="button-list">
  <button>Cancel</button>
  <button>Done</button>
</div>

<style>
  button {
    margin-right: 16px;
  }
</style>
```

</Split>

---

#### Problem: Who owns spacing?

---

<Split style={{ textAlign: 'left' ,width:  '90%'}}>

<Img
  src="https://penguin-talk-images.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/layout-components/buttons_mock_space.svg"
  alt="twitter mock"
  width="400px"
/>

```html
<div class="button-list">
  <button>Cancel</button>
  <button>Done</button>
</div>

<style>
  .button-list button {
    margin-right: 16px;
  }
</style>
```

</Split>

---

<Split style={{ textAlign: 'left' ,width:  '90%'}}>

<Img
  src="https://penguin-talk-images.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/layout-components/buttons_mock_highlight.svg"
  alt="twitter mock"
  width="400px"
/>

```html
<div class="button-list">
  <button>Cancel</button>
  <button>Done</button>
</div>

<style>
  .button-list button {
    margin-right: 16px;
  }
</style>
```

</Split>

---

<Split style={{ textAlign: 'left' ,width:  '90%'}}>

<Img
  src="https://penguin-talk-images.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/layout-components/buttons_mock_highlight_all.svg"
  alt="twitter mock"
  width="400px"
/>

```html
<div class="button-list">
  <button>Cancel</button>
  <button>Done</button>
</div>

<style>
  .button-list button {
    margin-right: 16px;
  }
</style>
```

</Split>

---

<Split style={{ textAlign: 'left' ,width:  '90%'}}>

<Img
  src="https://penguin-talk-images.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/layout-components/buttons_mock_highlight.svg"
  alt="twitter mock"
  width="400px"
/>

```html
<div class="button-list">
  <button>Cancel</button>
  <button>Done</button>
</div>

<style>
  .button-list button:not(:last-child) {
    margin-right: 16px;
  }
</style>
```

</Split>

---

<div class="button-list">
  <button>Cancel</button>
  <button>Done</button>
  <button>Done</button>

#### Problem: Reusability

---

<Split style={{ textAlign: 'left' ,width:  '90%'}}>

<Img
  src="https://penguin-talk-images.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/layout-components/buttons_mock_space.svg"
  alt="twitter mock"
  width={3 / 4}
/>

```html
<div class="button-list">
  <button>Cancel</button>
  <button>Done</button>
</div>

<style>
  .button-list button:not(:last-child) {
  }
  .some-container button:not(:last-child) {
  }
  .some-wrapper button:not(:last-child) {
  }
  /* ... */
</style>
```

</Split>

---

<Split style={{ textAlign: 'left' ,width:  '90%'}}>

<Img
  src="https://penguin-talk-images.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/layout-components/buttons_mock_space.svg"
  alt="twitter mock"
  width={3 / 4}
/>

```html
<div class="button-list">
  <button>Cancel</button>
  <button>Done</button>
</div>

<style>
  .some-container button:not(:last-child) {
    margin-right: 16px;
  }
  .some-wrapper button:not(:last-child) {
    margin-right: 8px;
  }
  /* ... */
</style>
```

</Split>

---

<SpacingScale />

---

<Split style={{ textAlign: 'left' ,width:  '90%'}}>

<Img
  src="https://penguin-talk-images.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/layout-components/buttons_mock_space.svg"
  alt="twitter mock"
  width={3 / 4}
/>

```html
<div class="button-list">
  <button>Cancel</button>
  <button>Done</button>
</div>

<style>
  .some-container button:not(:last-child) {
    margin-right: 16px;
  }
  .some-wrapper button:not(:last-child) {
    margin-right: 8px;
  }
  /* ... */
</style>
```

</Split>

#### Problem: CSS Pitfalls

- Margin collapsing
- Browser compatibility
- ...

- Who owns spacing?
- Reusability
- Consistency
- CSS Pitfalls

## What if I don't use React?

---

<Split style={{ textAlign: 'left', width: '90%' }}>

<Img
  src="https://penguin-talk-images.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/layout-components/buttons_mock_close.svg"
  alt="twitter mock"
  width="400px"
/>

```html
<style>
  .h-list {
    display: flex;
  }
  .h-list-small > *:not(:last-child) {
    margin-right: 8px;
  }
  .h-list-medium > *:not(:last-child) {
  }
  .h-list-large > *:not(:last-child) {
  }
</style>

<div class="h-list h-list-small">
  <button>Cancel</button>
  <button>Done</button>
</div>
```

</Split>

---

### What other components can we have?

- HorizontalList
- VerticalList
- ...

---

### UX and Engineering collaboration is key

---

## Is this new?

---

### What is not a Layout Component?

- CSS flex
- CSS grid

---

# Benefits

---

### Reusable layout componets

- `<HorizontalList space="small" />`
- `<VerticalList space="large" />`
- ...

---

### Consistent spacing in our apps

```jsx
const spacingScale = {
  small: 8,
  medium: 16,
  large: 32
};

<HorizontalList space="small">

// we don't allow this
<HorizontalList space="13px">
```

---

### Lowers CSS entry barrier to build UI's

```jsx
<VerticalList space="medium">
  <Text>Title</Title>
  <HorizontalList space="small">
    <Button>Cancel</Button>
    <Button>Done</Button>
  </HorizontalList>
</VerticalList>
```

---

### Increases developer experience and productivity

<Img
  src="https://penguin-talk-images.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/layout-components/twitter_mock.jpg"
  alt="twitter mock"
  height={3 / 4}
/>

---

### Better UX / Engineering collaboration

- Engineer: What is the spacing for this VerticalList?

- UX Designer: Oh that's is using large spacing

---

### Benefits

- Reusable layout component
- Consistent spacing in our apps
- Better UX / Engineering collaboration
- Lowers CSS entry barrier to build UI's
- Increases developer experience and productivity

---

### Let's revaluate the problems we had

---

## Problems

- Who owns spacing?
- Reusability
- Consistency
- CSS Pitfalls
- ...

---

### Resources

- https://adele.uxpin.com/
- https://medium.com/eightshapes-llc/space-in-design-systems-188bcbae0d62
- https://www.designsystems.com/space-grids-and-layouts/
- https://atomicdesign.bradfrost.com/
- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xxbc3wAztl0
- Mocks by @davecave: https://www.figma.com/community/file/887892609124245416

<Notes>

- https://designsystemsrepo.com/design-systems/
- https://seek-oss.github.io/braid-design-system/foundations/layout
- https://www.carbondesignsystem.com/guidelines/2x-grid/overview/
- https://polaris.shopify.com/components/structure/layout

</Notes>

---

### Takeaways

Layout components help us to:

- Increase code reusability and reduce the amount of CSS we write
- Be more productive when implementing layouts
- Collaborate better with UX and Engineering
- Increase visual consistency in our application

---

#### @MightyPenguinV
